numbered_ace_sentences: 1. The graph shows admissions advantages at elite colleges.
2. The graph focuses on the advantages of legacy applicants.
3. The 80th percentile of income lowers the chances for legacy applicants.
4. The 80th percentile of income also lowers the chances for normal applicants.
5. I wonder why the 80th percentile of income lowers these chances.
6. I usually assume that higher parents' income increases the chance of acceptance into a university.
7. This topic relates to me and my community.
8. Getting into elite colleges is very important in my life as a teenager.
9. Getting into elite colleges is very important in the lives of many other teenagers.
10. It is important to know what factors influence admissions decisions.
11. Being a legacy applicant is a factor that influences admissions decisions.
12. The headline is: Legacy Lift: Access to Elite Colleges.
